sub_topic: Identifying the planarity of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the graph G shown below. Determine whether G is planar or not using the Kuratowski's theorem.

Image: https://i.imgur.com/DYo7tYw.png
message_2:
Kuratowski's theorem states that a graph is planar if and only if it does not contain a subgraph that is homeomorphic to either K5 (the complete graph on 5 vertices) or K3,3 (the complete bipartite graph on two sets of 3 vertices).

In the given graph G, we can see that there are two sets of vertices, A = {a, b, c} and B = {x, y, z}, such that every vertex in A is connected to every vertex in B. This forms a complete bipartite graph K3,3.

Therefore, according to Kuratowski's theorem, the graph G is not planar.
